page.title: 04 FARMING AROUND PEEBLES
page.content: Farming.This is a hilly area,so most land is used for sheep grazing & forestry (eg.the Forestry Commission own Glentress Forest-NE of D.Block). Interview with Mr Brown of Bonnington Farm supplied the following data:- 300 acre farm (in family for 117 yrs). In 1985 112 acres under crops ie oats, barley,hay,silage,turnips & carrots. Beef cattle = Hereford/Charolais X:1.5 cows per acre.52 cows. Also 516 ewes, pure Suffolk & Suffolk X;843 lambs this year(none killed by foxes),number of twins-350.Other livestock-1 horse, 10 hens,4 dogs. Local advantage is plenty of rain;disadvantage is stoney ground,the farm also has one acre of marshland, protected for nature conservation.In 1984-5 Mr Brown spent Â£8,000 on machinery. Mr Brown's is a typical farm of the district.
